Experiment_description: Experiments involved testing a simple bag-of-tokens model and GRU-based models for classifying SPR sequences. The bag-of-tokens model was a single-layer neural classifier, while the GRU models used sequential token embeddings and mean-pooling for classification.
Significance: These experiments are important as they establish baseline performance levels for different model complexities in the context of SPR sequence classification. Insights from these experiments could guide future efforts to optimize model architecture for zero-shot generalization and improve handling of class imbalance.
Description: The bag-of-tokens approach involved creating a multiset representation of SPR sequences and training a neural classifier. The GRU models incorporated token embeddings, mean-pooling, and softmax layers to leverage sequential dependencies. Metrics such as accuracy, loss, and zero-shot rule transfer accuracy were used to assess performance.

List_of_included_plots.description: This confusion matrix reveals that the model struggles with classifying true negatives, while it performs better on true positives.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The high false positive and false negative counts indicate the model's difficulty in distinguishing between classes, suggesting a need for improved classification strategies or addressing class imbalance.

List_of_included_plots.description: This plot shows the training and validation accuracy over epochs for the GRU-based model.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The convergence of accuracies near 1.0 suggests effective learning and model generalization without overfitting.

List_of_included_plots.description: This plot illustrates the training and validation loss for the GRU-based model.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: The near-zero loss by the end of training indicates excellent model performance and low error rates.

Key_numerical_results.description: Zero-Shot Rule Transfer Accuracy (ZSRTA) for the bag-of-tokens model.
Key_numerical_results.analysis: Indicates moderate zero-shot generalization capability, highlighting potential for improvement with more sophisticated models.

Key_numerical_results.description: Validation accuracy for the GRU-based models.
Key_numerical_results.analysis: Reflects the models' high effectiveness in learning and generalizing patterns in the SPR_BENCH dataset.

Key_numerical_results.description: Validation loss for the GRU-based models.
Key_numerical_results.analysis: Demonstrates the models' ability to fit the data with minimal error.
